##### Pair And Set
In the event of loss of or damage to any article forming part of a pair or set, we shall not be liable for more than the value of the particular part which may be lost or damaged without reference to any special value which such part or parts may have as forming part or set but in any event not exceeding a proportionate part of the Benefit Limit in respect of the pair or set.

#### Section 11. 24 Hours Home Assistance Concierge Services
We will cover You for the utilization of one (1) concierge service up to a limit of $100 during a period of twelve (12) consecutive months starting from the Effective Date, subjected to the Waiting Period. We shall not be liable to pay for any parts or replacement unit of the repaired/defective item or its accessories.
questions: How does the Pair and Set clause limit the claim amount when only one item of a pair or set is lost or damaged, and how does this interact with the overall Benefit Limit for that pair or set?
In what scenarios would the insurer pay less than the full value of a lost or damaged item that is part of a pair or set, and how is the proportionate part of the Benefit Limit determined?
What exclusions or limitations apply to claims involving special value items that form part of a pair or set under this policy?
How does the policy treat claims for loss or damage to multiple items within a pair or set occurring simultaneously?
For the 24 Hours Home Assistance Concierge Services, what conditions must be met for a claim to be valid, including the timing of the claim relative to the Effective Date and the Waiting Period?
What is the maximum amount payable under the 24 Hours Home Assistance Concierge Services section, and how is this limit applied over the policy period?
Are costs for parts or replacement units of repaired or defective items covered under the Home Assistance Concierge Services, and how does this exclusion affect claim outcomes?
How does the policy define the scope of services covered under the 24 Hours Home Assistance Concierge Services, and what types of services are excluded?
If a claim involves both loss of an item in a pair or set and use of the concierge service for repair assistance, how are the limits and exclusions applied across these sections?
How does the Waiting Period affect eligibility for the 24 Hours Home Assistance Concierge Services, and what documentation is required to prove service utilization?
In the event of damage to an accessory of an item covered under the concierge service, what coverage limitations apply according to the policy?
How does the policy handle claims for items that are part of a set but have individual special values, and what evidence is required to establish the value of the lost or damaged part?
What are the implications for claims if the insured exceeds the $100 limit for concierge services within the twelve-month period starting from the Effective Date?
How does the policy address situations where the insured uses multiple concierge services for different items within the same policy period?
What documentation or proof is necessary to support a claim under the Pair and Set clause, especially when claiming for a proportionate part of the Benefit Limit?
How does the policy distinguish between repair services covered under the concierge service and replacement services that are excluded?
If an insured item forming part of a pair or set is partially damaged but still usable, how does the policy calculate the claim amount under the Pair and Set clause?
What happens if the insured attempts to claim for both the lost item and its accessory under the concierge service, considering the exclusion of parts or replacement units?
How does the policy ensure that the $100 concierge service limit is not exceeded when multiple repair requests are made for the same item within the coverage period?
Are there any general or section-specific exclusions that override the Pair and Set clause or the Home Assistance Concierge Services coverage, and how are conflicts between these handled?
